footnotes: [1980] i.e., remain in them temporarily, meaning until the Day of Resurrection.

ayah: No! You are going to know.
Then, no! You are going to know.
No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...[1981]
footnotes: [1981] The conclusion of this verse is estimated to be "...you would not have been distracted from preparing for the Hereafter."

ayah: You will surely see the Hellfire.
Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.[1982]
Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.[1983]
footnotes: [1983] i.e., the comforts of worldly life and whether you were grateful to AllƒÅh for His blessings.
